含义: The character '斤' primarily means 'catty,' a traditional Chinese unit of weight equivalent to about 500 grams. It can also refer to an axe or hatchet, reflecting its original pictographic representation.
字形: '斤' is a simple character consisting of four strokes. It resembles the shape of an axe, with a horizontal stroke at the top representing the blade and a vertical stroke representing the handle.
读音: The pronunciation of '斤' is 'jīn' in Mandarin.
字源: The character '斤' originated from a pictograph of an axe. Over time, its meaning expanded to include the unit of weight, likely due to the use of axes in measuring or dividing goods.

半斤八两 (bàn jīn bā liǎng) - six of one, half a dozen of the other
成语: 斤斤计较 (jīn jīn jì jiào) - to be overly calculating

例句: 他买了两斤苹果。 (Tā mǎi le liǎng jīn píngguǒ.) - He bought two catties of apples.
不要斤斤计较。 (Bù yào jīn jīn jì jiào.) - Don't be so calculating.
